title: Can OCE please be considered a region that doesn't have Ranked TT enabled for end of season rewards
body:
Ranked TT is only available for 8 hours a week on Thursday/Friday nights. Until today I wasn't even aware that we had ranked TT enabled.

Can OCE please be considered as a region without ranked TT? I'm assuming a lot of players, due to various commitments, struggle to play during the week and can only play weekends. it's unreasonable to gate off a reward that other regions have access to either via an always open queue or are given it for 50 ranked wins if their region doesn't have the game mode available.

Please allow OCE players to earn the TT graves chroma via the 50 ranked wins!

replies.body:
I think the problem is, that there are only really 2 options for them.

1. Make Graves easier to get in OCE TT than in the rest of the world.

2. Treat OCE as a region that doesn't have ranked TT, and so miss out entirely on a Chroma for Graves. _(just like we missed out on the ranked icon for TT a couple of years back)_

Option 1 will be seen as unfair by the rest of the world, because it devalues their chroma. 
Option 2 is stink for OCE players because obviously thats unfair.

So what can you do? 
You're truly stuck between a rock and a hard place.

Little Witch Eve makes a good point, and I agree with it!
But the fact that Riot hasn't enabled it on weekends already probably means that they don't think the queue would be healthy enough to survive, OR it would take players way from other queues and so disadvantage those games.

No matter what you do in this situation, someone will always lose and Riot will get the aggro. 
Either it's the rest of the world getting mad because almost everyone in OCE gets a chroma for Graves easy, or its OCE getting mad because almost no one gets a chroma for Graves, or its OCE getting mad because all their other queues are falling apart because TT is up for too long. 

No matter what happens here Riot takes flak from someone, and disadvantaging OCE is the lesser of two evils.

But you know what would solve this problem once and for all?

**DONT HAVE A F*CKING LIMITED EDITION BRAGGING RIGHTS SKIN THAT CAUSES TOXICITY IN THE FIRST PLACE!!! **
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

You've also got to consider the players who have played TT ranked all year to get gold. Giving the chroma away for 50 wins would completely devalue their effort in playing the queue.
If we just give it away for 50 wins, why would anyone play the queue at all next year. They can just ignore it and get the chroma for playing SR instead.

I'm considering our options here. If we do see heavy engagement with TT ranked this week, we will consider expanding TT ranked in OCE until the end of the season. But if more people don't join the queue, then expanding it heavily will make matchmaking almost impossible.

Thanks for the response, I know I'll be on this Thurs/Frid grinding out placements hopefully there will be plenty of others as well to get the queue enabled on weekends for the rest of the season. Any Tips/Tricks for someone that's barely played TT but played plenty of SR and ARAM?

Not a bad place to go is to check out the [3v3 Bible. ](http://www.3v3bible.com/) It's a pretty long read, but it goes over the different kinds of meta within TT - as well as why they are that meta. 

Outside of high ranks though, you should be able to just play the Jungle Meta without any issues. I'm also happy to answer any questions here too!

TT is basically a smaller SR, with no wards, and more defined team strengths and weaknesses due to the smaller team comps. I made a [post](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/4yOAaYev?comment=00010000) on the nuances of TT a while ago that briefly mentions this.

My best tip is to carefully consider if and when you need to recall or push. Because your team and the map are so small, having one player back in base or losing a skirmish (even with no deaths) means a huge loss in pressure that can see you quickly losing (or gaining, if you're on the winning side) multiple turrets.

Try to time your backs with your team so that you're all on the map at the same time to make a play, but only when you know the enemy isn't likely to push down one of your lanes.
Don't invade if either of your other teammates are back in base as you'll quickly find yourself outnumbered, unless you are super fed or the enemy has been pushed out of their jungle.

Also remember to use your trinket rather than facechecking brush. (trinket can also spot traps and invisible champions)

EDIT: Oh also, treat the middle section of the map like another lane that needs to be controlled. Try to maintain vision there every now and then by having the jungler briefly check it or sit there if there are no camps or viable ganks. This will prevent most ganks.
And Vilemaw pit is just another gank path for top lane. Almost no one expects it.

Could you at least make TT ranked the entire times it's up now, so we don't have half the games being TT norms where it doesn't even count. It's hard enough for players like me who work in the evening most nights, and the days I have off is when its TT norms

Just in case you didn't see the announcement, TT Ranked is also available on Saturday and Sunday nights for now until the end of season, but I understand that you may be working those nights as well. If we continue to see more players playing TT ranked for the rewards grind, we may expand it further in the final weeks of the season.

Making it available on the weekends until the season ends would solve a lot of issues...

making it available on weekends permanently would solve alot of issues. 

OCE is almost as big as RU now, I'm sure it can cope an extra queue on weekends without causing long queue waits.

I completely understand Riot is in a tough spot where people are going to be upset regardless of what they do. But at the moment OCE gets the short end of the stick by having the limited queue and not getting the hand out that regions that don't have the queue are getting.

The only reason that I brought it up is that the regions that don't have ranked TT get the TT chroma for having 50 ranked wins during the season. 

So regions that have the queue always active have the option to grind out gold whenever they have the time. And regions that don't have ranked TT get it for simply playing ranked (50 wins is nothing). If a player has real world commitments for the next 4 weeks on Thursdays and Fridays there's no way to get that chroma. 

If they had mentioned it earlier in the season that there would be an extra reward for ranked TT I would have started the grind earlier like I did with flex queue.
